SENT.plain: Sinovenous thrombosis is a definite cause of mortality or morbidity in newborns
Perinatal hypoxia is one of the well known risk factors
Two term newborns were diagnosed to have cerebral venous thrombosis after a hypoxic-ischemic insult
They were later found to have carnitine deficiency
Carnitine was previously shown to have inhibitory effects on thrombogenesis in experimental studies
The possible contribution of carnitine in thrombogenesis was discussed
